Based on my search results, here's what I found about "The Peasants" (2023) film and its Netflix adaptation:

## Overview
"The Peasants (Polish: Chłopi) is a 2023 adult animated historical drama film directed and written by DK Welchman and Hugh Welchman."(no content)The film is "an adaptation of Władysław Reymont's novel of the same name, the film was produced using the painted animation technique similar to the pair's previous film, Loving Vincent."

## Netflix Availability
"The Peasants" is now available on US Netflix, and viewers "can watch The Peasants through Flatrate,Rent,buy on the platforms: Netflix,Google Play Movies,Amazon Video,Apple TV,YouTube,Fandango At Home,Microsoft Store"

## Unique Animation Style
The film uses an extraordinary hand-painted animation technique. "Initially the film was shot with the actors, and then more than a hundred painters in four studios in Poland, Lithuania, Ukraine, and Serbia painted oil paintings based on the shots, which became frames in the film."(no content)"The Peasants took over 200,000 hours to animate, as it merged live-action photography, real paintings, and animation into a unique blend of mediums."

## Visual Appeal and Artistic Heritage
"The film features works from the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries, with an emphasis on Young Poland artists. It includes interpretations of works by artists such as Józef Chełmoński, Ferdynand Ruszczyc and Leon Wyczółkowski."(no content)"Each frame is hand-painted, which creates a beautiful, gallery-like dimension to the work, allowing the viewer to feel they are witnessing a historical fable come to life."

## Modern Retelling with Contemporary Relevance
While set in late 19th century Poland, the film has modern appeal. "The Peasants calls attention to the difference between our modern society and historical customs, but also reminds us of timeless emotions and passions. This pain of Jagna is, unfortunately, still seen today, albeit in different forms."

## Story and Youth Appeal
"Jagna is a young woman determined to forge her own path in a late 19th century Polish village" The film follows themes that resonate with younger audiences, including "a haunting feminist narrative, and touches on the concept that, in a patriarchy, women may be the ones so vehemently tearing each other down."

## Critical Recognition
"The Peasants is based on the beloved novel of the same name by Władysław Stanisław Reymont, which won the 1924 Nobel Prize for Literature." The film was "the official submission of Poland for the 'Best International Feature Film' category of the 96th Academy Awards in 2024."

The film represents a unique blend of classical art techniques with modern storytelling, making historical themes accessible to contemporary audiences through its innovative visual approach.
